name: HONORS PHYSICS II

values.comments:
This course parallels and extends the content of PHYS 151, at a somewhat higher
mathematical level. Subjects investigated include: Electric and magnetic fields; Coulomb's, Ampere's, and Faraday's laws; special relativity; Maxwell's equations; and electromagnetic radiation.

Students found the course to be “very difficult but rewarding” and felt that they better understood many concepts after taking the class. One student wished the class had a TA and recitation.

Professor Gladney “was a good instructor who effectively taught the material.” He was “very good at detailing the underlying physics and mathematical reasoning behind everything and ultimately uniting almost everything we did in a single model and theory.”

PHYS 171 is “an incredibly difficult and in-depth course,” described by one student in one word: “intense.” One student wrote that the homework was very difficult, time consuming, and graded harshly. The course is recommended for well-prepared students in engineering and the physical sciences, and particularly for those planning to major in physics. It fulfills the Physical World Sector. Pre-requisites include Math 114 and PHYS 150 or 170 and co-requisite of Math 240. Note: Fewer than eight students reviewed this course.
